sub_title: Researcher on Health Technology Assessment / Health Economics at Maastricht University Medical Center
summary:
I am involved in multiple research projects, both national and international, related to Health Technology Assessment (HTA). This includes acting as a health economic lead in assessments of (diagnostic) technologies for The National Institute for Health and Clinical Excellence (NICE). In addition, I am involved in teaching and supervising master and PhD students.

Research interest and focus
I have extensive experience in the field of HTA, specifically with model-based economic evaluations and related statistical methods (e.g. evidence synthesis methods, survival analysis, real-world data analyses). My methodological interests include the acknowledgement of patient heterogeneity in HTA (focus of my PhD thesis), value of information analyses (VOI; I co-authored the VOI appendix for the Dutch pharmacoeconomic guideline by the National Health Care Institute) and the use of alternative study designs to inform decision making (I believe this is essential to enhance personalised medicine).
